ESP.TRADUIT: Hunting in Skyrim is a roleplaying mod that introduces a hunting class system to the game. Adds a Hunting Guild, Quests, better hunting prices, and more! No perks version.

Deer Bait

[pagebreak]

A Hunter's Notes on

Skeevers

 [pagebreak] Skeevers! I hate Skeevers! Skeevers are small and very aggressive rodent-like creatures that will attack anything that moves on sight. Skeevers tend to be found in caves or other underground structures, but they can also be found in the wilderness. Though a Skeever is a relatively small creature, it is not to be underestimated. One Skeever alone will try to rip your face off then dart to the left or right with amazing agility, making it hard to kill at times. Often they will attack in groups of two to four and this is when they can prove a real nuisance to the unwary. One creature will attack from the front, whilst the others will try and flank you as you try to kill the first. This first one may then jump left or right whilst the others move around you, making them hard targets. Though not often fatal to a well armed hunter, they will inflict some serious wounds if care is not taken with this frenzied dizzy attack pattern. If you see a Skeever in the distance, either avoid it or use a ranged weapon. If it is in a group the others will attack you immediately, so try to pick them off at a distance, thereby making your life easier once they get in close and start to snap at your legs. Beware also of scratches and bites as they carry the disease Ataxia which can give you a bad case of the shakes. Skeever do however make a half decent meal when times are hard, and their tails are prized by Alchemists. Signed..... Anaraavi

NOTICE TO ALL HUNTERS unting in Skyrim is about to become big business. Keeping the traditional feeling of the hunt, and living off the land, I have decided to create something special. Here will be a Hunting Guild, the first of it's kind in all of Tamriel! Once complete, we will have a place to trade, swap stories, earn a real living, and make a name for ourselves. Jarls, Generals, and people of all trades will call upon us to collect their much needed meats and pelts, as well as rid the land of terrible beasts. Remember the tales of the Great Bears of The Reach? How would you like to be paid to hunt such legendary creatures? The wait will soon be over, brothers and sisters. [pagebreak]

~~O~~

 I am away making some arrangements, but there are already some tasks to be completed. If you do these things, fellow hunter, you will be rewarded and will be the first real member of our fantastic Guild! 1. A large wolf has been causing problems for the fair people of Riverwood. It was last seen near the southeast entrance of the town. Your job is to take it down. 2. A group of Giant Mudcrabs have made the Shrine of Zenithar their home. Remove them. 3. Elberond, the Hunting Guild Porter, has been tasked by the local traders to bring in some Wolf Pelts and Deer or Elk Hides. It would be great if these could be collected also. Take this note to accept the hunt! We will have lots to do upon my return! [pagebreak]
ESP.TRADUIT:
AVISO A TODOS LOS CAZADORES a caza en Skyrim está apunto de convertirse en un gran negocio. Mantener el sentimiento tradicional de la caza, y vivir de la tierra, he decidido crear algo especial. ¡Aquí estará el Gremio de Caza, el primero de su clase en todo Tamriel! Una vez terminado, tendremos un lugar para comerciar, intercambiar historias, ganarse la vida, y hacernos un nombre. Jarls, generales, y gente de todos los oficios nos llamarán para obtener sus necesarias carnes y pieles, así como librar a la tierra de terribles bestias. ¿Recuerdas las historias de los grandes osos en La Cuenca? ¿Cómo te gustaría que se pagara por cazar a esas legendarias criaturas?La espera acabará pronto, hermanos. [pagebreak]

~~O~~

 Estoy lejos haciendo algunos arreglos, pero ya hay algunas tareas que deben completarse. ¡Si haces estas cosas, compañero cazador, serás recompensado y serás el primer miembro real de nuestro fantástico Gremio! 1. Un gran lobo ha estado causando problemas a las personas de Cauce Boscoso. Fue visto por última vez cerca de la entrada sureste de la ciudad. Tu trabajo es matarlo. 2. Un grupo de Cangrejos de barro gigantes han hecho del Santuario de Zenithar su hogar. Elimínalos. 3. Elberond, el portero del Gremio de Caza, ha sido encargado por los comerciantes locales para conseguir algunas pieles de lobo y oso. Sería genial que pudieran ser obtenidos también. ¡Coge esta nota para aceptar la caza! ¡Tendremos mucho que hacer a mi regreso! [pagebreak]

[pagebreak]

Skinning In The Wilds

by Heidmir Starkad

[pagebreak]

The Portable Skinning Kit

The Portable Skinning Kit allows an experienced hunter to properly skin their kill in the wild, without needing to use an appropriate skinning station back at camp. It includes all of the necessary tools needed to skin an animal correctly, allowing the hunter to improve on their skinning skills. [pagebreak]

Variations

Skinning Kits usually come in three variations. Basic, Common, and Expert; each upgrade allowing more animals to be skinned. The Basic Kit covers your general prey animals, while Expert includes the tools to skin big game animals like Mammoths. The need to separate them, rather than use a single kit for all animals, came about due to price as well as specialisation. Some hunters only hunt small prey and meal animals, like Deer. These hunters wanted a simple Skinning Kit that suited their requirements, and didn't want to pay more for something they didn't need.

Usage

Basic Skinning Kit Deer, Elk, Fox, Fox (Snow), Goat. Common Skinning Kit Basic Animal List plus: Cow, Horker, Horse, Wolf, Wolf (Ice). Expert Skinning Kit Basic & Common Animal List plus: Bear, Bear (Cave), Bear (Snow), Mammoth, Sabrecat, Sabrecat (Snowy), Troll, Troll (Frost).

NOTICE TO ALL HUNTERS ellow hunters name is Engar! I call upon you to help me with a big undertaking. My dream has always been to build a Guild centered around my passion, hunting. Rather than living the lonely life, we should band together to forge something special. We will offer our services to all who require it, to collect pelts, feed the hungry, and rid the land of horrible beasts for the safety of all. There should be some tasks to complete on the map of Skyrim in the corner, please fell free to complete them while I am away making arrangements. You will be rewarded! The wait will soon be over, brothers; Hunters of Skyrim
ESP.TRADUIT: AVISO A TODOS LOS CAZADORES ompañeros de caza mi nombre es Engar! Os hago un llamado para que me ayudéis con un gran proyecto. Mi sueño siempre ha sido crear un Gremio en torno ami pasión, la caza. En vez de vivir la vida solitaria, debemos unirnos para forjar algo especial. Ofreceremos nuestros servicios a todos los que lo requieran, para obtener pieles, alimentar a los hambrientos, y librar a la tierra de bestias horribles por la seguridad de todos. Debe haber algunas tareas para completar en el mapa de Skyrim en la esquina, por favor no dudes en completarlas mientras estoy fuera haciendo arreglos. ¡Serás recompensado! La espera se acabará pronto, hermanos; Cazadores de Skyrim

[pagebreak]

The Art Of Skinning

by Heidmir Starkad

[pagebreak]

The True Skill of Hunting

unting your kill, some believe, is the hardest part of the trade. It is true that some beasts, like the ferocious Snow Bears of Skyrim, require a more skilled hunter to take them down. Strength, speed, agility, wisdom, a good knowledge of the terrain, and a well strung bow are all key parts of hunting. But many hunters in the wilds forget that skinning your animal is just as, if not more important. Skinning a quality pelt, and learning to better your technique, truly separates the fools of the fields from the great hunters of legend; hunters like Gromm. Hunters and Adventurers have taken to stripping an animal of it's parts almost as quickly as the soul of the animal left it's body. Ham handedly ripping the skin from the beast with whatever weapon they had, and pulling out the insides like mad men not caring about the damage they might cause to the skin. Over the years I have attempted to teach novice hunters that I meet the proper way to skin an animal. Sadly many care not, due in part to the lack of quality skins found at market these days, and most traders no longer ask for the best pelts because quality skins are a rare find. It's a vicious circle. I have perfected my teachings throughout my days, thanks in part to great hunters like Gromm for sharing their years of hard earned skill. This book will serve as the culmination of all I have learned, and will give you a better understanding of crafting the best skins possible. [pagebreak]

Skinning the Carcass

he true skill of hunting lies in your ability to skin an animal. When you have made your kill, take your carcass to a suitable skinning station like a Skinning Table, or pull out your Portable Skinning Kit (these are as uncommon today as a quality skin). Rather than harshly ripping what you need from the beast, take your time and carefully remove the skin. Take care not to pierce the guts, so as to keep the integrity of the skin intact. Detach the skin from the animal with a quality dagger. Feed your blade around the bones and muscle, using just the tip, and be sure to take your time!

The better you get at this technique, the more likely you are to obtain more usable skin from one animal. I have met hunters who were able to skin enough usable hide from an animal that at market it fetch's the price of two skins! [pagebreak]

Improving Pelts & Hides

y using the correct technique for skinning your animal you may only obtain a pelt of the same value as any other, if you sell it as is. However the more you skin correctly, the more you'll improve your skill at doing so. With a higher skill you will be able to take your skins to a Skinning Rack and improve their quality (a station similar to a Tanning Rack) and increase their grade.

These improved pelts aren't regularly used by Smiths in armour creation, but are sort after by certain buyers. I feel once enough quality pelts return to market again, we will see renewed interest in them. Of course the higher the grade a skin is, the bigger the price it will fetch. [pagebreak]

Pelt & Hide Grades

n the old days, pelts and hides came in four grades: Standard Good Fine Flawless Standard grade pelts are crafted at a suitable Skinning station. The following grades are improved at a Skinning Rack: Good grade pelts are an improvement over Standard pelts, Fine quality grade pelts are a better quality than Good pelts, and Flawless grade skins are the best possible grade. As your skinning skills increase you will be able to improve a pelt beyond it's standard quality. Only the best hunters and hide skinners are able to create Flawless Pelts. There was a time when these were sort after by all of the Smiths who served noble men and women who ruled over counties, holds, and regions across all of Tamriel! [pagebreak]

The Portable Skinning Kit

[pagebreak] ortable Skinning Kits allow an experienced hunter to properly skin their kill in the wild, without needing to use an appropriate skinning station back at camp. It includes all of the necessary tools needed to skin an animal correctly, allowing the hunter to improve on their skinning skills whilst in the field. These can be purchased from specialised traders, and also crafted if you a skilled enough hunter. As already mentioned, Portable Skinning Kits are rare these days, so you may need to ask around in order to find a seller. To use a Portable Skinning Kit, lay it down on a flat surface, use the kit, and set it up. It will take some time to set up and pack away your kits. But the more you use them, the less time it will take. Skinning Kits usually come in three variations: Basic Common Expert Each upgrade allowing more animals to be skinned. The Basic Kit covers your general prey animals, while Expert includes the tools to skin big game animals like Mammoths. The need to separate them, rather than use a single kit for all animals, came about due to price as well as specialisation. Some hunters only hunt small prey and meal animals, like Deer. These hunters wanted a simple Skinning Kit that suited their requirements, and didn't want to pay more for something they didn't need. [pagebreak]

Variations & Usage

Basic Skinning Kit Deer, Elk, Fox, Goat, Hawk, Rabbit. Common Skinning Kit Basic Animal List plus: Cow, Horker, Horse, Wolf. Expert Skinning Kit Basic & Common Animal List plus: Bear, Mammoth, Sabrecat, Troll. [pagebreak]

Summary

ith everything written on these pages, you should be able to better your craft and become a much finer hunter. Remember, the art of skinning comes not only from your crafting, but of the way in which you hunt. Understand your prey, your terrain, the smell and sounds of the creatures of this world, and become one with nature. Hunt as though you also belong in the wild. If you truly can grasp the fine art of skinning, traders across the lands of Tamriel will be sending their requests by the batch full! And who knows, maybe one day storytellers will be spinning tales not only of your hunting talents, but of the fine skins you produced! Signed, Heidmir Starkad Good Hunting

<font face="$HandwrittenFont"> <font size="28">Animal Removal</font>
<font size="18">To whom should read this letter,
There have been some strange vanishings and killings in <Alias=Location>, and we believe a wild animal to be the cause.
Please come, with haste, to help rid us of this beast. A reward will be offered.
-- Citizens of <Alias=Location>. </font>

NOTICE TO ALL HUNTING GUILD MEMBERS

unters of Skyrim. Chests marked as "Hunting Guild Chest" are for communal use. I will ensure they contain a fairly regular stock of health potions, and other necessities members may need, as and when required. Don't store items in these chests! Members of this Guild are entitled to take any items found inside them! - Elberond

There's only one way to eat a brace of Coneys. Boil in water over a wood fire. Add herbs and spices as required, and salt for seasoning if available. Be careful they're not wriggling when you eat them!
Portable Skinning Kit (Expert) - Snowy Sabre Cat
Portable Skinning Kit (Basic) - Snowy Sabre Cat
Portable Skinning Kit (Common) - Snowy Sabre Cat

ESP.TRADUIT: Piel de gato sable de las nieves
Piel de gato sable del valle
Piel de gato sable del valle
Piel de gato sable de las nieves

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've heard whispers of a Hunting guild, are they true?
ESP.TRADUIT: He oído rumores de un Gremio de caza, ¿son verdad?

ESP.ORIGINAL: They are indeed true. A man named Engar is setting it up in the Drunken Huntsman in Whiterun. Speak to Elrindir there, he knows more.
ESP.TRADUIT: Ellos realmente existen. Un hombre llamado Engar está instalado en El cazador ebrio en Carrera Blanca. Habla con Elrindir allí, él sabe más.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Are you a member of this new Guild?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Eres un miembro de este nuevo Gremio?

ESP.ORIGINAL: No, it wasn't for me. I prefer the solitary life, living off the land on my own merits. But to each his own.
ESP.TRADUIT: No, no era para mí. Prefiero la vida solitaria, viviendo de la tierra por mis propios méritos. Pero cada uno a lo suyo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: What do you know of this Guild?
They offer a service to farmers, townsfolk, blacksmiths, Jarl's... anybody really.
ESP.TRADUIT: Ofrecen un servicio a los granjeros, herreros, lugareños, el Jarl... realmente cualquiera.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Collecting pelts for a busy blacksmith, dealing with a nuisance pack of wolves, things of that nature.
ESP.TRADUIT: Reúne pieles para un herrero ocupado, tiene molestias con una manada de lobos, cosas de la naturaleza.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Do you know how can I join?
Speak with Elrindir at the Drunken Huntsman in Whiterun, if you can't find Engar. He can probably help you.
ESP.TRADUIT: Habla con Elrindir en El cazador ebrio en Carrera Blanca, si no puedes encontrar a Engar. Él probablemente pueda ayudarte.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Fellow hunter! Are you here about the new Guild?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Compañero cazador! ¿Estás aqui por el nuevo Gremio?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Well well, it's the hunter who took down Great White. Huh, I could've done that.
ESP.TRADUIT: Bueno bueno, este es el cazador que derribó al Gran Blanco. Huh, yo podría haberlo hecho.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've heard this is the home of the hunting Guild.
ESP.TRADUIT: He oído que esta es la casa del Gremio de caza.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Yes it is, head on downstairs, there's a journal on a table for you to read!
ESP.TRADUIT: Sí lo es, en la planta baja, ¡hay un diario en la mesa para que lo leas!

ESP.ORIGINAL: That's great. Remember I only want five at a time. There's no point dealing with odds and sods.
ESP.TRADUIT: Eso es genial. Recuerda que sólo quiero cinco a la vez. No quiero chismes.
Aquí tienes estas pieles de lobo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I have the pelts you requested.
Really? You have all twenty of them?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿En serio? ¿Tienes todos los veinte de ellos?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Thank you! The local shopkeepers were getting desperate for these.
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Gracias! Los tenderos locales estaban desesperados por éstos.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I'll happily purchase more pelts off you when you have them. Bring me five at a time, I'll pay well for them.
ESP.TRADUIT: Con mucho gusto voy a comprarte más pieles cuando tengas. Tráeme cinco a la vez, te pagaré bien por ellos.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I'm sorry I haven't got them yet.
ESP.TRADUIT: Lo siento, no las tengo todavía.

ESP.ORIGINAL: No problem. Just come back to me when you have them.
ESP.TRADUIT: No hay problema. Sólo vuelve a verme cuando los tengas.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Hello Associate, how can I help?
Hello friend, how goes the hunt?
It's a pleasure to see you again, Associate!
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Es un placer volver a verte, socio!
Aquí tienes estas pieles de oso.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Cave Bear pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de oso de cueva.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Snow Bear Pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de oso polar.
Aquí tienes estas pieles de zorro.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Hello there! Are you here to join the Hunting Guild?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Hola! ¿Has venido a unirte al Gremio de Caza?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Yes I am. I completed the tasks in the journal left on the table.
ESP.TRADUIT: Sí. He completado las tareas del diario que está sobre la mesa.

ESP.ORIGINAL: So that was you? I've heard reports of your deeds! Thank you for helping us out.
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Así que eras tú? ¡He escuchado noticias de tus hazañas! Gracias por ayudarnos.

ESP.ORIGINAL: For your service to the Guild, welcome to the Hunters of Skyrim. You are our first member!
ESP.TRADUIT: Para tu servicio al Gremio, bienvenido a los Cazadores de Skyrim. ¡Eres nuestro primer miembro!
Aquí tienes estas pieles de ciervo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Snow Fox pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de zorro de las nieves.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Ice Wolf pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de lobo de hielo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Sabre Cat pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de gato sable.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Here take these Snow Sabre Cat pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Aquí tienes estas pieles de gato sable de las nieves.
Aquí tienes estas pieles de hombre lobo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Good work, these are not easy to come by. Have you visited Fort Dawnguard at all?
ESP.TRADUIT: Buen trabajo, éstos no son fáciles de conseguir. ¿Has visitado el Fuerte de la Guardia del Alba?

ESP.ORIGINAL: I'm sorry I don't have any to trade.
ESP.TRADUIT: Lo siento, no tengo nada para comerciar.

ESP.ORIGINAL: No problem, just let me know when you do.
ESP.TRADUIT: No hay problema. Sólo házmelo saber cuando lo hagas.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Yes. Bears have been causing a lot of trouble for the farmers near Solitude. It's become too dangerous to travel alone.
ESP.TRADUIT: Sí. Los osos han estado causando muchos problemas a los granjeros cerca de Soledad. Se ha vuelto demasiado peligroso viajar solo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: A reward has been offered to us for taking care of the problem. It won't be easy though, these Bears are tougher than usual.
ESP.TRADUIT: Una recompensa nos ha sido ofrecida por resolver el problema. Aunque no será fácil, estos osos son más duros de lo habitual.

ESP.ORIGINAL: If you hunt down and kill these Bears, there may be advancement in it for you.
ESP.TRADUIT: Si cazas y matas estos osos, puede haber un avance en ello para ti.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Yes there's a lot of work for us to do. The Guild is just getting started!
ESP.TRADUIT: Sí, hay un montón de trabajo para que hagamos. ¡Es sólo el comienzo del Gremio!

ESP.ORIGINAL: We are in need of new building supplies to continue construction of this great hall. However our supply chains have stopped, halting our progress.
ESP.TRADUIT: Estamos con la necesidad de nuevos materiales de construcción para continuar la construcción de esta gran sala. Sin embargo, nuestras cadenas de suministros se han detenido, parando nuestro progreso.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Go to our trade route and find out what's happening to our supplies.
ESP.TRADUIT: Ves a nuestra ruta comercial y averigua lo que está pasando con nuestros suministros.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Can you tell me more about the Hunting Guild?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Puedes decirme más sobre el Gremio de caza?

ESP.ORIGINAL: What would you like to know, friend?
Why start a Guild? Hunters can already buy and sell supplies.
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Por qué entrar en un gremio? Los cazadores ya pueden comprar y vender suministros.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Because we wanted to create a profession, a stable livelihood if you will, for hunters to earn a living.
ESP.TRADUIT: Porque queríamos crear una profesión, un medio de vida estable por así decirlo, para que los cazadores se ganen la vida.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Much like the Fighters Guild and Mages Guild, we wanted an organised establishment to pursue a passion worth having.
ESP.TRADUIT: Al igual que el Gremio de Luchadores y el Gremio de Magos, queríamos un establecimiento organizado para perseguir una pasión teniendo valor.

ESP.ORIGINAL: We will take contracts and jobs, help tradesmen and Jarls, anyone with a problem that we can solve. To get paid, and enjoy doing it at the same time!
ESP.TRADUIT: Aceptaremos contratos y trabajos, ayudaremos a comerciantes y Jarls, cualquiera con un problema que podamos resolver. ¡Para recibir el pago, y disfrutar haciéndolo al mismo tiempo!

ESP.ORIGINAL: What work is there to do?
There is always something to do! If I have no contracts for you, I will buy any pelts you have at a good price.
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Siempre hay algo que hacer! Si no tengo contratos para ti, te compraré algunas pieles que tengas a buen precio.

ESP.ORIGINAL: When we have more members, I'm sure they'll have favors or jobs for you to.
ESP.TRADUIT: Cuando tengamos más miembros, estoy seguro de que tendrán favores o trabajos para ti.

ESP.ORIGINAL: There is always something to do! If I have no contracts for you, I will buy any pelts you have at a good price.
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Siempre hay algo que hacer! Si no tengo contratos para ti, te compraré algunas pieles que tengas a buen precio.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Other Guild members may also have favors or jobs for you.
ESP.TRADUIT: Otros miembros del Gremio también pueden tener favores o trabajos para ti.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Have you heard where Great White may have been seen last?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Has oído donde puede haber sido visto por última vez el Gran Blanco?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Last I heard, she was seen wandering the swamps west of Morthal.
ESP.TRADUIT: Lo último que supe, fue vista vagando por los pantanos del noroeste de Morthal.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Ah yes, the legendary creature Great White has been sighted again recently. You've heard of the Great White Stag of course?
ESP.TRADUIT: Ah sí, la criatura legendaria Gran Blanco se ha visto de nuevo recientemente. ¿Has oído hablar del Ciervo Gran Blanco?

ESP.ORIGINAL: No matter either way. Go out there and hunt that beast down. Take this note, and be on your way!
ESP.TRADUIT: No importa la manera. Sal ahí fuera y caza a la bestia. Toma esta nota y ve.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Have you killed the beast yet, fellow hunter?
ESP.TRADUIT: ¿Has matado ya a la bestia, compañero cazador?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Ok come back when you have!
I see you have the Heart. You really are a fine hunter!
ESP.TRADUIT: Veo que tienes el Corazón. ¡Realmente eres un buen cazador!

ESP.ORIGINAL: Yes I do! Here, do you want to buy it?
Why yes of course, I will give you 900 gold for it.
ESP.TRADUIT: Porque sí, por supuesto. Te daré 900 monedas por eso.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Great, here's your gold, and your reward for hunting in the name of our Guild!
ESP.TRADUIT: ¡Genial, aquí tienes tus monedas, y tu recompensa por cazar en el nombre de nuestro Gremio!

ESP.ORIGINAL: No thanks, I'll keep it as a trophy.
ESP.TRADUIT: No, gracias. Lo guardaré como un trofeo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: No problem, friend. Here is your reward for hunting in the name of our Guild!
ESP.TRADUIT: No hay problema, amigo. ¡Aquí está tu recompensa por cazar en el nombre de nuestro Gremio!

ESP.ORIGINAL: Thank you, and thank you to the Hunting Guild for your fine work!
Thank you, and thank you to the Hunting Guild for your fine work!
Thank you, and thank you to the Hunting Guild for your fine work!
Excellent, thank you Hunters of Skyrim.
Excellent, thank you Hunters of Skyrim.
Excellent, thank you Hunters of Skyrim.
Excellent, thank you Hunters of Skyrim.
Excellent, thank you Hunters of Skyrim.
The local blacksmith in Riverwood is in need of some hides.
The blacksmith in Solitude desperately needs some pelts. He is paying well for them.
An Alchemist is in need of some supplies. Collect what you need, and return them to the client.
An animal is causing problems for some folks. Here read this note, and take care of it.
You can only carry out one Standard Contract at a time.
I have the Hawk Feathers you needed.
I have the Bear Claws you needed.
A Blacksmith has requested some pelts.
ESP.TRADUIT: Un herrero nos ha pedido algunas pieles.

ESP.ORIGINAL: We've had an order of pelts from a Blacksmith.
ESP.TRADUIT: Tenemos un pedido de pieles de parte de un herrero.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Hunter this order has just come in.
Since you are friendly with the Guild that like to "borrow" things, I'm sure you won't mind fulfilling a contract for them.
You can only carry out one Common Contract at a time.
Thank you very much! I'll be sure to spread the word of your service.
Thank you very much! I'll be sure to spread the word of your good service.
Thank you very much! I'll be sure to tell people about your excellent service, hunter.
I have killed the <Alias=Animal>. Your lands are now a little safer.
Thank you for your services, Hunter!
Fantastic news, our local farmers will be pleased.
Not bad, I'll be recommending you to anyone who may need the Hunter's services
ESP.TRADUIT: No esta mal, te recomendaré a cualquiera que necesite los servicios de los Cazadores.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I need a new Guild Log Book.
Every member of the Hunters of Skyrim needs a Log Book where they can keep track of their hunts, contracts completed, things of that nature.
So here you are Associate, your very own Hunting Guild Log Book. Over time you may need to keep track of other things, but I'll let you know.
I'm having problems tracking some things.
If you're having problems tracking some things, simply request a new Log Book from me. Remember to throw the old one away!
Would you like to join the Hunting Guild to be a merchant?
Hmm that depends, what's in it for me?
ESP.TRADUIT: Hmm eso depende, ¿y yo que gano?

ESP.ORIGINAL: You get to be part of a group of like-minded people.
Well, I'm not sure. I like living the life of a free hunter.
ESP.TRADUIT: Pues no estoy seguro. Me gusta vivir como cazador libre.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Tell you what, if you do something for me, I'll join your Guild.
Show me how good of a hunter you really are. Bring me some Halk Feathers.
Please bring me the Hawk Feathers.
And as promised, I would be happy to join the Hunting Guild. I'll make my way to Whiterun soon.
Ah yes, that's a great idea. I'd recommend recruiting a Hunter for the job. First we need to build the area for the shop. Do you have the 1800 gold?
Yes of course, let's get started.
Great. Let's begin then. Go and find a Hunter to recruit. I'll have the shop area constructed.
I know! Leave it with me.
Ok go do what you do, fellow Hunter.
Have the Skeevers been taken care of yet?
Yes, have you killed them all?
Good news! The Jarl will be pleased. But as Hunters of Skyrim, it must have been a piece of piss. You need to prove yourself more.
If you want to earn the right to Hunt without fear of criminality, we ask more of you, Hunter.
I've come from the Hunting Guild, Steward.
Ah yes, the poachers who wish to hunt freely; and for the coin of the service no less!
You know, ever since this bastard war started, folk have been having these crazy ideas. Letting poachers earn an honest living?!
The Jarl seems keen to bring in new industry to these lands, so who am I to question their wisdom?
What can we do to gain approval?
Well it's not going to be easy. The Jarl may be keen, but he still isn't set on the idea just yet. There are tasks you must complete.
Well, a Hunter of your stature deserves a real challenge...
ESP.TRADUIT: Bueno, un cazador de tu talla se merece un desafío de verdad...

ESP.ORIGINAL: We have a small Skeever problem down at the Hall of the Dead. I'd send one of our soldiers, but you deserve a hunt like this.
Report back to me when you have taken care of it.
We need a new Whiterun Guild Merchant.
We need time to mourn the death of the last one first.
It's time you learnt the proper art of skinning, Associate.
ESP.TRADUIT: Es hora de que aprendas el verdadero arte de desollar, asociado.

ESP.ORIGINAL: What do you have to teach me, Elberond?
I am going to teach you the proper way of skinning an animal.
The more you do it, the better you'll get at it, and your pelts will be worth more coin.
Tell me what I need to do.
ESP.TRADUIT: Dime lo que tengo que hacer.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Firstly, you need to forget what you know. A real hunter doesn't tear animal pelts and parts from their kill; they skillfully remove.
A real hunter will skin their kill, with either a portable skinning kit, or at a suitable skinning station, gaining the most from their hunt.
I need you to bring me a Deer Carcass. Go and hunt me a Deer, but bring it back whole.
The skinning room is almost ready, and should be complete by the time you get back.
Associate, please bring me a Deer Carcass.
I have the Deer Carcass here.
That's great good work. Now, take it to the Skinning Table in the newly built Skinning Room.
Do you have the Deer Carcass?
Yes, I have skinned the animal.
Excellent work. You are well on your way to becoming a fine hunter!
You have learnt the basics of the art of skinning. Take this book, aptly titled The Art Of Skinning, to learn more.
Also I give you this Portable Skinning Kit. You'll be able to skin some of your kills in the wilds. These aren't very common, so value it.
Let me know when you're done!
What would you like to improve?
I'll have a selection of available upgrades pinned to the notice board in the corner within the hour.
When you want to purchase an upgrade, bring me the upgrade note.
Which would you like to purchase?
Excellent, I'll have the construction begin as soon as possible. Shouldn't take more than a day to build.
Good idea, I'll have the builders start work on it as soon as possible. Shouldn't take more than a day or so to complete.
Ah yes, that's a great idea. I suggest we get another hunter for the job. Let's hope this one doesn't die!
ESP.TRADUIT: Ah, sí, es una gran idea. Sugiero que consigamos otro cazador para este trabajo. ¡Esperemos que este no muera!

ESP.ORIGINAL: Tell me what I need to know.
First of all select the trophy base, and choose which trophy to erect. Different bases can have different trophies.
If you have the Heart of Great White on you, you can use that for this trophy.
Have you selected your trophy yet?
Yes I have chosen my trophy, how do I proceed?
Now that you have your trophy selected, you can see what you need to create it at the Trophy Workbench.
On this occasion though I will give you what you need.
Have you created your trophy yet?
That's great! You'll now be able to craft trophies to place in or around Guild locations.
So you'd like to learn how to craft trophies for the Guild Hall?
I see you have chosen your trophy.
Associate, I have work for you to do!
We need to begin establishing our Guild in this fine land. That means renown, respect, and above all else, contracts.
Exactly! We need to start taking contracts, jobs, and hunting requests from people in order to establish ourselves.
So to start things off, I have arranged for a small order to be delivered to a local blacksmith.
Fulfill the contract, and more should come through as word gets out of who we are and what we're about!
Yes, make sure to get it completed as quickly as you can. You don't want people waiting too long. Hunting takes time though!
How's the contract coming along, Associate?
I'm just setting up a new contract. Give me a moment.
That's a good choice. I'll have it constructed, shouldn't take longer than five days to complete.
Excellent work Associate. These types of contracts won't be all we can offer, but they'll help to keep us going and build our reputation.
And for your continued service to the Hunters of Skyrim, I think you're ready for advancement.
Congratulations, you are now a Skinner in the Hunters of Skyrim. And as comes with the rank, take this armour. May it serve you well, Skinner.
Thank you very much, Hunter, these are fantastic quality. Here, take this as payment.
What upgrades do you think the Guild could finance?
Excellent idea. Members will have a place to craft their trophies!
In fact come and see me when construction is complete, and I'll teach you about trophy crafting. Should take about 3 days.
What do you need from me next?
Here at Dragonsreach we will shortly be having a feast. I need you to complete the following task.
ESP.TRADUIT: Vamos a celebrar un festejo dentro de poco aquí en Cuenca del Dragón. Necesito que completes la siguiente tarea.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Do this for me, and I'll allow you to complete your outpost here in Whiterun, and allow the continued construction of your Main Hall.
Have you completed your task yet?
Come and see me when you have.
ESP.TRADUIT: Ven a verme cuando lo tengas.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Well done hunter. Deer and Elk, although weak, can be hard to catch.
I can now allow you to continue building your Guild. However stay alert, we may call upon your services again in the near future.
Associate, I need to speak with you.
What is it you need, Elberond?
Although Engar received the go ahead to begin building the guild, the Jarl has now decided we must work for it.
We have been summoned to speak with the Steward of Whiterun to discuss what they want. Please go speak with him.
Until we get this ironed out, we can't continue our construction.
Hello hunter, I need to give you something.
I just need to add to your map where our Main Guild Hall will be located. Construction has already begun!
How did you get on with the Steward?
It's done, we have gained Whiterun approval!
Excellent news, Associate! Thank you for your service to the Guild. Now that we can continue building our Guild, I have more work for you!
No problem, come see me when you've taken care of it.
ESP.TRADUIT: Sin problema, vuelve a verme cuando te hayas encargado de eso.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I'm just setting up a new bounty.
I'm just setting up a new bounty.
The local blacksmith in Solitude is in need of <Alias=SamplePelt>s. He needs <Global=HISJL1STPeltTotal> and will pay well for them.
The local blacksmith in Solitude is in need of <Alias=SamplePelt>s. He needs <Global=HISJL1STPeltTotal> and will pay well for them.
The local blacksmith in Solitude is in need of <Alias=SamplePelt>s. He needs <Global=HISJL1STPeltTotal> and will pay well for them.
The local blacksmith in Solitude is in need of <Alias=SamplePelt>s. He needs <Global=HISJL1STPeltTotal> and will pay well for them.
The local blacksmith in Solitude is in need of <Alias=SamplePelt>s. He needs <Global=HISJL1STPeltTotal> and will pay well for them.
I have returned the <Alias=SamplePelt>s to the blacksmith, and received a good hardy reward.
Return the <Alias=SamplePelt>s to the blacksmith in Solitude.

Skyrim is a harsh and unforgiving land, and biting cold that covers the land is home to some mighty beasts. Seek out and kill a White Wolf, Snow Bear and Frost Troll using a Woodsman's Axe without wearing any armour. Woodsman's Axes can be crafted at forges as a reward for completing Hunting Challenge I Rank 4.
Hunt and a kill a White Wolf. (<Global=HISHuntChallengeGlobal01>/1)
Hunt and a kill a Snow Bear. (<Global=HISHuntChallengeGlobal02>/1)
Hunt and a kill a Frost Troll. (<Global=HISHuntChallengeGlobal03>/1)
Three large Bears are causing despair for the farmers of Solitude. They've called upon the Hunters.
ESP.TRADUIT: Tres Osos grandes están causando la desaparición de los granjeros en Soledad. Han llamado a los Cazadores.

ESP.ORIGINAL: The farmers of Whiterun have a problem with a Troll and they want it dead.
ESP.TRADUIT: Los granjeros de Carrera Blanca tienen un problema con un Troll y lo quieren muerto.

ESP.ORIGINAL: The Troll has made a fresh kill, and must be close by. I need to find it.
ESP.TRADUIT: Una presa fresca del Troll, debe estar cerca. Necesito encontrarlo.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've killed the Troll, now to take it's heart as my prize.
ESP.TRADUIT: He matado al Troll, ahora cogeré su corazón como premio.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've claimed my prize. The hunt is over.
ESP.TRADUIT: He reclamado mi premio. La caza ha terminado.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Go to the Troll's last known location and look for clues as to where it might be.
ESP.TRADUIT: Ve a la última ubicación conocida del Troll y busca pistas sobre dónde podría estar.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Follow the blood trail leading westward and kill the Troll.
ESP.TRADUIT: Sigue el rastro de sangre que conduce hacia el oeste y mata al Troll.

ESP.ORIGINAL: With the troll dead, claim the heart as your prize.
ESP.TRADUIT: Con el Troll muerto, reclama su corazón como premio.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Elberond has told me that our Hunting Guild requires the approval from the Jarl of Whiterun before we can expand any further. We are seen as poachers, so things need to change.
ESP.TRADUIT: Elberond me ha dicho que nuestro Gremio de Cazadores requiere de la aprobación del Jarl de Carrera Blanca antes de que podamos expandirnos más. Nos ven como si fueramos furtivos, con lo que las cosas tienen que cambiar.

ESP.ORIGINAL: I have completed the first task to gain Hunting Guild approval here in Whiterun.
I have completed all the tasks set out by <Alias.ShortName=Steward>. We have been given permission to continue building our Hunting Guild. I should inform Elberond.
I have told Elberond of our success with the Steward of Whiterun. We can now continue construction of our Guild Halls in the Whiterun Hold.
Gain the approval from the Jarl of Whiterun's Steward.
Inform Elberond of your success with the Steward.

Welcome to the Hunting in Skyrim trapping beta. To set a trap drop it from your inventory and when it is on the ground activate it, and choose Place Trap. From there activate again and follow the contextual messages.
Kill 2 Hagraven with a Huntsman's Axe during the night (between 8pm and 4am). Huntsman's Axes can be crafted at forges as a reward for completing Hunting Challenge I Rank 9.
There are no finer hunters in all of Tamriel than the natives of Valenwood; the Bosmer (Wood Elves). Elberond, Hunters of Skyrim Guild Porter in the Whiterun outpost, is a Bosmer.

A hunter's skills lie not only in their physical and mental ability, but also in the tools they use. A well strung bow made from fine wood, as well as a sharp and light dagger, are natural requirements.
The Hunters of Skyrim is a newly established guild in Tamriel, and merchants and traders are glad to have their services available. There are some, however, who see them as a threat.

ESP.ORIGINAL:
~ Portable Skinning Kit ~
What would you like to do?

Common Portable Skinning Kit ----------------------------------------------------------------
These kits are able to skin the following animals:
Cow, Deer, Elk, Fox, Goat, Hawk, Horker, Horse, Rabbit, and Wolf.

Hunting Skill Menu ----------------------------------------------------------------
Huntsman Feats - <Global=HISHuntingSkillGlobal> Hunting Kills - <Global=HISKILLSTATTOTAL> Hunting Skill - <Global=HISHuntingSkillActual> Skill Points - <Global=HISSkillPointsTotalGlobal>

PATH OF THE HUNTER ----------------------------------------------------------------
Hunting Skill - <Global=HISHuntingSkillActual> Skinning Skill - <Global=HISSkinSkillActual> Skill Points - <Global=HISSkillPointsTotalGlobal>

PATH OF THE HUNTER ----------------------------------------------------------------
Hunting Skill - <Global=HISHuntingSkillActual> Skinning Skill - <Global=HISSkinSkillActual> Skill Points - <Global=HISSkillPointsTotalGlobal>

~ Guild Contracts ~
Guild contracts are repeatable, radiant quests to collect a specific item for an NPC in the world, hunt down various types of animals, and other types of quests. Repeatable and radiant means never ending; there will always be something to do in the guild!

~ Animal Carcasses ~
Animals & Creatures marked as Unique will not drop carcasses. This is for safety. However during quests where you have to kill a special animal/creature, whether part of this mod or not, it's a good idea to turn the system off before killing it. The reason is because they may drop a unique object, which will be deleted when the carcass is added to the animal.

Craft Mammoth Portable Skinning Kits ----------------------------------------------------------------
Skinning Skill - 30 1 x Fine Mammoth Pelt 5 x Elven Daggers 12 x Leather Strips

Mammoth Portable Skinning Kit ----------------------------------------------------------------
Mammoth Portable Skinning Kits can only be used to skin Mammoths, however Mammoth Carcasses taken when you posses a Mammoth Kit will weigh 50%% less.

Special Portable Skinning Kits ----------------------------------------------------------------

HUNTER'S KILL VISION ----------------------------------------------------------------
Hunter's Kill Vision is an ability that makes your hunting kills glow for a certain amount of time. It will affect all animals and creatures that have their kills tracked in your Hunting Guild Log Book. It comes in 3 levels, each upgrade making the glow last longer.
Once unlocked It can be turned on/off by casting your Enable/Disable Kill Vision power; using the shout key.

HUNTING PERKS ----------------------------------------------------------------
Users of the No Perks version of this mod, and of SKSE, are able to unlock the perks in this mod via this menu; as long as they have enough perk points.

Hunters of Skyrim, here you will find training targets and dummies to help you improve your skills in Archery and One-Handed. You will not learn anything about Archery if you don't stand behind the barrier wall. Also, firing with the lights off should improve your skill more. You'll find the chain on the wall to toggle the lights.

CLEAN SKINNING ----------------------------------------------------------------
When unlocked, this ability enables the player to obtain two skins when they skin an animal carcass, and comes in 2 levels. Level 1 enables two skins to be obtained from Cow, Deer, Elk, Goat, Fox, Snow Fox, Hawk, Horse, and Wolves. Level 2 enables two skins to be obtained from all skinnable animals.

QUALITY SKINNING ----------------------------------------------------------------
When unlocked, players will be able to improve the skins they receive from skinning an animal at a Skinning Rack. Improved skins come in three grades; Good, Fine, Flawless. Each grade makes the skin more valuable. Improved skins cannot be used for crafting normal weapons and armour, but can be sold for a higher than normal price, and used to craft special Hunting Guild equipment.

HUNTER'S INSTINCT ----------------------------------------------------------------
Hunter's Instinct, when cast, allows you to see clues that might lead you to an animal's den/location. This will come in handy when carrying out Hunting Contracts, or simply whilst exploring. As your level increases more clues will be viewable at once, and harder to find clues will be displayed. This includes clues to legendary creature locations.
Do you wish to take down and destroy this trophy?

~ Skinning Table ~
Here you can fully skin your animal, skillfully removing it's pelt or hide, and it's parts. Once you have skinned an animal, it's parts will be added to your inventory. To use the Skinning Table, simply bring an animal carcass obtained from a kill. You can then use this carcass to craft a pelt. Skinning animals will increase your Skinning Skill, enabling you to improve the pelts you craft here at a Skinning Rack.

REALISTIC SKINNING SYSTEM ----------------------------------------------------------------
The Realistic Skinning system is a freeform and dynamic method for obtaining animal parts. Animals will be skinned upon activation, and their model will change to a "skinned" version when finished. An optional animation can also play to show the player getting down to skin the animal.
As players skin their animals time will pass by. The animal's size governs the length of time.

SKINNING SKILL INFO ----------------------------------------------------------------
The player's Skinning Skill can be improved by skinning animal carcasses and improving animal skins. Skinning Skill also has a small influence on a player's Hunting Skill. As they increase their Skinning Skill players will gain more renown and become well known for skinning high grades of pelts, unlocking higher level contracts.

HUNTING SKILL INFO ----------------------------------------------------------------
The player's Hunting skill increases as they hunt and kill animals. The player's Skinning Skill also has a small influence on their Hunting skill. The higher this skill the more abilities players will be able to unlock, and higher level quests will become available. Hunting Skill is linked to Guild hunting quests & contracts.

Portable Skinning Kits ----------------------------------------------------------------
Portable Skinning Kits allow you to skin your carcasses out in the wilds. They come in different types, and can be crafted at Portable Skinning Kit Crafting Tables.

A big animal took down this poor soul. Claw and teeth marks on the bones show the animal is likely a large Bear, possibly a Cave Bear.
A big animal took down this poor soul. Teeth and claw marks on the bones show the animal is likely a Bear, possibly a Snow Bear judging by the region.
Do you want to crawl into the Animal Den?
While in combat, crawling into an Animal Den will leave you vulnerable to attack.
There's barely any flesh left. Only a big Sabrecat could clean these bones so well, possibly a Snowy Sabrecat.
Do you want to crawl out of the Animal Den?
By the way these bones are clean and crumbled, the animal is likely a Troll.

This trap is now broken.
Either repair it or sell for scrap.
Are you sure you want to use a repair kit to fix this trap?

~ Skinning Rack ~
Here you can improve the grade of the animal pelts and hides that you craft on a Skinning Table. As your Skinning Skill increases, you will be able to improve pelts to higher grades, eventually crafting flawless pelts. The higher the grade of the pelt or hide, the bigger the price it will fetch. You can also craft Leather from animal pelts.
You cannot create a trophy here yet.
Convert your Real Wildlife Large Pelts into two standard animal pelts.

TRAP CRAFTING ----------------------------------------------------------------
Improving your crafting ability allows you to create traps that are stronger, last longer, and have a higher chance of catching an animal.
Traps come in four qualities: Novice, Apprentice, Journeyman, Master.

~ Portable Skinning ~
To use the Portable Skinning Kit simply drop it from your inventory, then Activate the object and choose Set Up Kit. Once set up, Activate it again and select Use Kit. When you're finished, Activate it, and choose Pack Away.
